programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff operates on a dog rushed in after a growth on its neck ruptures. The team performs a risky procedure on a pair of rescued miniature donkeys

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: The team members find themselves in a dangerous situation when they attempt to rescue dogs involved in a dog-fighting ring. And, for one lucky pit bull, a new home awaits

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: A dangerously ill dog is rescued from the streets of New Orleans by Tania and Tia. Meanwhile, pitbull Chong takes a turn for the worse as his cancerous tumour grows

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Jackson Galaxy comes to the aid of a mother and daughter whose feline companion Missy is determined to kill their other cat Fluffy

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy works with a Bengal that keeps spraying on every piece of furniture in the house. Plus, an energetic cat threatens to harm a toddler

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson sets out to create a treehouse bed-and-breakfast designed for romance, featuring stained glass, a bedroom and the biggest bathroom Pete has ever built

programme.title: Saved by the Barn
programme.desc: A cow called Buttercup comes to the barn, but the team is concerned about her feisty behaviour. Ginger the lamb battles a life-threatening infection

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Fun facts about animals, including how swarms of blind bats avoid collision, whether mice really like cheese, why slugs are so slimy and what makes manatees farts so special

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: How humpback whales are able to leap so far out of the water, why dogs tilt their heads and how do spiders shed their own skin. Plus, why do animals gather in swarms?

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Atz gives Jane a lesson in rabbit skinning, Eve experiences conflicting thoughts about deer hunting and Otto pulls porcupine quills out of a colts face

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: Graduation is around the corner but intense rotations are still ahead - the trainees must show no weakness on the road to becoming qualified veterinarians

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: With just days to go before graduation, the students finish their final rotations - but although the countdown has started emergencies still need attention

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 16 October 1998. Featuring B*Witched, 911, Garbage, The Cardigans, Monica, Natalie Imbruglia, Fatboy Slim and Billie Piper

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 23 October 1998. Featuring 911, Cliff Richard, Meja, REM, Billie Piper, Dru Hill, George Michael and Spacedust

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Jensen presents an edition first broadcast November 15, 1979. Includes performances by the Jam, Cliff Richard, Thin Lizzy, BA Robertson, Suzi Quatro, the Moody Blues, Kool and the Gang, Secret Affair, the Ramblers, Showaddywaddy and Dr Hook. Plus, dance sequences by Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Gary Davies and Susie Mathis present the pop chart programme first broadcast on 17 November 1988. Featuring Yazz, All About Eve, INXS, Mica Paris, Tanita Tikaram, Robin Beck and Salt-N-Pepa

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Wright presents the pop chart show, first broadcast on 19 November 1981. Featuring Modern Romance, The Pretenders, Fun Boy Three, ABC, Trevor Walters, Julio Iglesias, Diana Ross, Soft Cell and Zoo

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Claudia Simon and Tony Dortie present the programme, first broadcast on 14 November 1991 and featuring performances by Rozalla, Seal, Tina Turner, Altern-8, Michael Jackson, REM and Vic Reeves and the Wonderstuff

programme.title: The Songs of Nick Drake: Way to Blue
programme.desc: Highlights of a concert celebrating the singer-songwriters music at the Barbican Centre in London, curated by legendary producer Joe Boyd. Leading artists present their interpretations of his tracks, including Vashti Bunyan, Green Gartside, Lisa Hannigan, Scott Matthews, Teddy Thompson and Krystle Warren.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Top of the Pops and The Old Grey Whistle Test, featuring Alice Cooper, New York Dolls, Peter Green, Queen, Robin Trower, John Martyn, Whitesnake, Joan Jett and Black Sabbath

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Pete Townshend of the Who, acoustic numbers by Davy Graham and Ralph McTell, and the talents of Americans Nils Lofgren and Ted Nugent. Also featured are performances by the Faces, Chris Spedding, the Runaways, Judas Priest, ZZ Top and the Cate Brothers

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 16 October 1998. Featuring B*Witched, 911, Garbage, The Cardigans, Monica, Natalie Imbruglia, Fatboy Slim and Billie Piper

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 23 October 1998. Featuring 911, Cliff Richard, Meja, REM, Billie Piper, Dru Hill, George Michael and Spacedust

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Tristan is welcomed back to Darrowby, where neglected animals and tight-fisted farmers cause problems for the vets. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Tristan accidentally injects a farmer with a vaccine intended for cows, while Helen wonders why James is always visiting a pet-less joiner. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy and Peter Davison

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.sub-title: If Music Be the Food of Love
programme.desc: The vets are puzzled when Farmer Biggins asks them to treat his perfectly healthy cows, while Tristan discovers the object of his affections sings in the choral society. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison

programme.title: All Your Faces
programme.desc: Victims of violent crime and perpetrators meet up in a restorative justice group in order to engage in mediated dialogue and try to heal from their trauma. Among the participants are a victim of sexual assault, three people who have been burgled or robbed and offenders convicted of violent robberies. French drama, starring Birane Ba and Leïla Bekhti

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.sub-title: Goldie Hawn, Thora Hird and John Blashford-Snell
programme.desc: An edition of the chat show from 1981 in which Michael Parkinson is joined by actresses Goldie Hawn and Thora Hird and explorer John Blashford-Snell

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Jerry takes out yet another endowment policy and Tom and Barbara begin to have misgivings about their plans for old age. Special performance of the classic comedy that was originally recorded in the presence of Elizabeth II and Prince Philip and first broadcast in 1978

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: The government faces financial ruin, but that does not seem to worry Sir Humphrey, who goes to extreme lengths to get his latest pay rise scheme approved. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Tristan is welcomed back to Darrowby, where neglected animals and tight-fisted farmers cause problems for the vets. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Tristan accidentally injects a farmer with a vaccine intended for cows, while Helen wonders why James is always visiting a pet-less joiner. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy and Peter Davison

programme.sub-title: If Music Be the Food of Love
programme.desc: The vets are puzzled when Farmer Biggins asks them to treat his perfectly healthy cows, while Tristan discovers the object of his affections sings in the choral society. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Gaby Roslin host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Our Holiday Was Not as Advertised
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Gloria Hunniford, and Louise Minchin investigate the cases of holiday-makers who say the reality of their trips was far from what was advertised by the travel company, including the Sicilian hotel that turned out to be a four-hour walk from the historic city. Plus, advice on investing in a campervan conversion and tips for using a mobile abroad without facing a costly bill

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.sub-title: Good Things Come in Small Packages
programme.desc: Martin Roberts contemplates whether a house in Wales is the smallest he has ever encountered in his 20 years on the programme. Dion Dublin is captivated by a rather funky, retro carpet in a terrace in Lancashire, while Tommy Walsh is in Wandsworth, south London, where a one-bedroom garden flat has potential to add space

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Ardingly, West Sussex, band mates Henry and Oscar, with their expert Danny Sebastian, take on competitive couple Nina and Rakesh, advised by Kate Bliss. Host Natasha Raskin Sharp monitors the contest and also meets an artist who can make his masterpieces disappear. Martin Frost creates amazing vanishing fore edge paintings on the unbound edges of a books pages, which are only visible when the pages are fanned out

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When one of the lads in a local rugby team is attacked, Donal wonders if its a case of jealousy between the players or whether theres something more serious going on. Marlene and Eve arent getting on, so when Marlene sees Eves husband looking intimate with another woman, she wonders what she should do. Cameron Cuffe, Kerri Quinn and Tara Lynne ONeill star

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple from the Surrey town of Epsom enjoy the spectacular landscape in Argyll and Bute as Nicki Chapman provides them with some expert property advice. For their budget of £600,000 they want a house with views that just keep on giving. Nicki also takes to the water on Loch Lomond, to meet a family who have owned and lived on an island for 70 years

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam head to Doncaster to transform John and Alasdairs bland new-build garden into a Eurovision-winning garden. The pair would love a garden that embraces their love of Eurovision, whether through literal flags and themed colours of participating countries or something more esoteric. The team needs to achieve all this on a £3,750 budget

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Phil Serrell and Tahmina Ghaffar enjoy the last leg of their trip in Cornwall. Tahmina goes gaga for a polished stone that reveals a naturally formed landscape scene and is drawn to a pair of royal souvenirs with regal charm. Meanwhile, Phil uncovers a mystery metal kitchen gadget with a surprisingly unusual purpose. Away from the shops, the duo take a detour into the tropics - without leaving the UK - as they explore one of the worlds largest greenhouses and discover the wonders of a man-made rainforest. With their final auction looming, the pressure is well-and-truly on

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong. with guest co-host Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo co-hosts the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Farm 999
programme.sub-title: High Stakes GPS Sting and a Life Saved by Air Ambulance
programme.desc: Police close in on an organised crime gang targeting farms across northern England and stealing high-tech GPS systems. After months of painstaking detective work, a high stakes sting operation is launched to bring the thieves to justice. In Leicestershire, a huge barn fire devastates a family run dairy farm, threatening cattle and destroying winter feed. In Scotland, reporter Paul Colgan meets farmer Debbie Duffus, as she is reunited with the air ambulance team who saved her life

programme.title: Return to Paradise
programme.desc: The CEO of a dating app is poisoned during a spiritual ceremony at a corporate retreat, yet no one else drinking the same psychedelic tea was affected. As Mackenzie Clarke tracks a pattern of deception, she finds herself in a world even murkier and more sordid than murder - online dating. Drama, starring Anna Samson and Lloyd Griffith

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Gabby Logan hosts, as comedian Nish Kumar and journalist Cathy Newman join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton. As usual, all concerned poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Sitcom about a father and daughter reunited when the latter falls pregnant. Exhausted Gemma, living with her three-month-old daughter, sees her formerly estranged mother Davina move in. Instead of helping, her mum lives an irritatingly carefree life. Meanwhile, father Malcolm is living back at the bedsit, sleeping on an inflatable bed on the landing. Missing her dad and in a state of despair, Gemma conspires with Malcolm and Derek to hatch a plot to oust Davina. Starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The Blame Game
programme.desc: Tim McGarry, Colin Murphy, Diona Doherty and Neil Delamere are joined by guest Kerry Godliman for the panel show taking a sideways look at the weeks news. Comedy asides and good craic abound as they turn their wit and satirical spin on the people and events who are making the news in Northern Ireland and beyond

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Hollywood stars Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson, who play a Neil Diamond tribute act in the biographical drama Song Sung Blue. Comic actor Ben Stiller discusses Stiller and Meara: Nothing Is Lost, his documentary about his comedy-duo parents Jerry Stiller and Anne Meara, while Oscar-winner DaVine Joy Randolph reflects on her afterlife romcom Eternity. Plus, American singer-songwriter Sombr performs his current single 12 to 12

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The search for the UKs Next Drag Race Superstar is nearly over, and Mama Ru is testing the queens comedy chops with a challenge that has seen many a well-seasoned queen fall at the last hurdle, the comedy roast - and this one comes with an added new-age twist. Comedian, writer and actor Sophie Willan is on hand to help coach the queens and joins Ru, Michelle Visage, and Alan Carr on the judging panel as the contestants vie for a much coveted place in the final

programme.title: Tell Me Lies
programme.sub-title: Did Your Dirty Words Comes Out to Play?
programme.desc: At Evan and Brees rehearsal dinner in the present day, tensions swirl beneath the celebrations. Lucy sneaks off to hook up with Max, deliberately luring Stephen to catch her. Flashbacks reveal messy Thanksgiving drama when a snowed-in campus forces everyone to Evans for dinner, Thriller, starring Grace Van Patten, Branden Cook and Catherine Missal

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Imad Alarnab and Ravinder Bhogal and special guest Tom Allen. Helen McGinn picks the wines and Martha Swales shares tips on growing your own food

programme.title: Mary at 90: A Lifetime of Cooking
programme.desc: Mary Berry is joined by broadcaster Alex Jones and they celebrate how Marys friends and family, as well as the viewers, have been at the heart of her cooking for 60 years. Together, they cook a cheesy mushroom and spinach lasagne, a reinvention of Marys 1970s chocolate cake, her husband Pauls favourite cheesy nutter snacks, and her Victoria sandwich

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: A look ahead to the weekends matches, including Arsenal v Manchester City. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Burnley and Chelsea

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Gruffalo
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of Julia Donaldsons best-selling childrens book. It tells the tale of a little mouse who takes a walk through the woods in search of a nut, only to encounter a fox, an owl and a snake who all want to eat him. To escape their clutches, the quick-witted rodent creates an imaginary monster to scare away his attackers - but it turns out to be all too real. Robbie Coltrane heads the voice cast as the Gruffalo, with James Corden as the Mouse and Rob Brydon, John Hurt and Tom Wilkinson as the predators

programme.title: The Gruffalos Child
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of the sequel to Julia Donaldsons best-selling childrens book, reuniting all the voice cast from the original. The Gruffalo has raised his daughter on tales of the big, bad mouse, the only creature in the forest he is frightened of. Despite her fathers warnings, she sets off in search of this scary creature, along the way encountering the snake, owl and the fox. But when she still has no luck finding the evil rodent, she begins to think he does not exist after all. Robbie Coltrane, James Corden and Rob Brydon lend their voices, with Shirley Henderson as Gruffalo Jr

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Husband and wife Peter and Stella compete against siblings Matthew and Katie, exploring the medieval Warwickshire town of Stratford-upon-Avon for items of value, alongside experts Tim Weeks and Izzie Balmer. Charlie Ross monitors their progress and also catches up with Thomas Forrester, who brings along an amazing collection of playing cards, some dating back to the 16th century. Charlie learns how the 100 years war brought playing cards to Britain and discovers how the earliest cards also act as a fascinating social record of life during the 16th and 17th centuries

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, Jacqui Joseph sifts through the car boots in search of three hidden gems she can save, transform and turn a profit on. Upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith takes on a pair of retro chairs, while woodworker Ollie Allen reimagines a rusty metal filing cabinet. Jacqui herself sees profit-making potential in some innocuous rolls of fabric

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Cwmbran, south Wales, Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill are tasked with creating a relaxed, free-flowing garden with a seating area and a way to attract wildlife for retired archaeologist Jane on a budget of £6,000

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps an opera singer and his husband find a house in Norfolk with space inside to hold small concerts and a garden big enough to keep a couple of pigs

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoons news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts the game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all. The contestants are siblings Jack and Hannah from Aberdare and Cardiff, mother and daughter Jacqui and Lola from Stockport, and friends Mel and Liz from Sydenham and High Wycombe

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly, Claudia Winkleman and the Strictly entourage head to Blackpools world-famous Tower Ballroom, where things get started with a routine featuring the professionals and pop superstars Steps. Over the years the Tower Ballrooms elegant surroundings have been host to thousands of amateur and professional dancers and tonight the tradition continues as Alex Kingston, Amber Davies, Balvinider Sopal, George Clarke, Karen Carney and Lewis Cope battle to get their names at the top of the leaderboard - although La Voix will not be with them after sustaining an injury

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: Game show, with celebrity experts Clare Balding, Zoe Ball, Bill Bailey, Lou Sanders, Konnie Huq, Tommy Fury and - in the twin chair - best pals Sam Thompson and Pete Wicks. Their job is to help contestants answer questions - aware that one wrong answer means someone else gets a chance

programme.title: Wild Cherry
programme.sub-title: Call It Mothers Intuition or Whatever
programme.desc: As the police hunt for Iris, the mothers refuse to listen to Lornas concerns about what the girls are up to. Juliet falls out with Lorna and gets closer to Gigi, while Allegra does a secret deal with K Rizz. The App gets more dangerous, with serious consequences as a photo circulates

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Nottingham Forest at Anfield and Newcastle United v Manchester City at St James Park. Liverpool suffered their first defeat of Arne Slots reign at home to Forest last term, with Callum Hudson-Odoi scoring the only goal of the game. Newcastle were looking for their first home win over the Citizens in the league since January 2019. Plus, Burnley v Chelsea, Bournemouth v West Ham United, Brighton and Hove Albion v Brentford, Fulham v Sunderland and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace

programme.title: The Football Interview
programme.desc: Kelly Somers has a conversation with Arsenal and England winger Bukayo Saka

programme.title: Cyrano
programme.desc: Poet and swordsman Cyrano de Bergerac can improvise a poem while fighting a duel, but is too self-conscious to woo the love of his life. Seeking an outlet for his feelings, he helps a handsome but shy friend to win her heart through love letters. Musical romance, starring Peter Dinklage, Haley Bennett and Kelvin Harrison Jr

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Wallace and Gromit: A Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Nick Parks Bafta-winning film which introduced the animated inventor and his faithful canine sidekick to the world. Wallace is distraught when his cheese supply runs out, so he decides to take a trip to the moon. All he needs to do is build himself a space rocket. With the voice of Peter Sallis

programme.title: Nativity!
programme.desc: A primary school teacher is given the job of directing a nativity play and is determined to outdo a rival from a nearby private school. When he dishonestly claims his ex-girlfriend is a Hollywood producer and is coming to see the show with an eye on making a film, he finds himself becoming a local celebrity. Comedy, starring Martin Freeman and Ashley Jensen

programme.title: Here We Go
programme.desc: Comedy focusing on members of the Jessop family as they navigate a combination of lifes everyday challenges. Paul gives Rachel a family voucher for a theme park which is valid for six months. Just before it reaches its expiry date - and with a neighbours dog in tow - the Jessops finally attempt to use it. Alison Steadman, Katherine Parkinson, Jim Howick, Tom Basden, Freya Parks and Tori Allen-Martin star

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Sitcom about a father and daughter reunited when the latter falls pregnant. Exhausted Gemma, living with her three-month-old daughter, sees her formerly estranged mother Davina move in. Instead of helping, her mum lives an irritatingly carefree life. Meanwhile, father Malcolm is living back at the bedsit, sleeping on an inflatable bed on the landing. Missing her dad and in a state of despair, Gemma conspires with Malcolm and Derek to hatch a plot to oust Davina. Starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams race from the surf mecca El Zonte on the Pacific coast across the entirety of El Salvador, known as the land of volcanoes, before entering Honduras to reach the third checkpoint, the colonial mountain town of Valle de Angeles. With the gap between teams reduced to just three and a half hours, Anita Rani and Bal Nazran are first to depart, eager to maintain their lead. However, Roman and Harleymoon Kemp hatch a plan to steal first place, by speeding along the coast to enter Honduras by sea

programme.title: Men of the Manosphere
programme.desc: James Blake enters the virtual world of manhood, often referred to as the manosphere, in search of status, wealth and relationships. He meets three young men who have turned to male social media influencers for guidance and instruction as they seek to better themselves and achieve success in different areas of their lives, both on and offline

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Josh Jones hosts the West heat at St Georges, a multi-purpose, fully accessible live music and arts venue in the heart of Bristol. Carwyn Blayney, Will Owen, Omari Douglas, Jess Carrivick and Alfie Dundas take to the stage in a bid to impress judges Priya Hall, Harriet Dyer and Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Sarah Keyworth hosts, as second heat contenders Eli Hart, Farhan Solo, Chloe Reynolds, Will BF and Monica Hsueh take to the stage of Birminghams Hockley Social Club in a bid to book their place in the final. Head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri is joined in her ranks by comedian, writer and podcaster Aurie Styla and local Brum stand-up Lindsey Santoro

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Alexandra Palace in north London, venue of the BBCs first ever television broadcast, stages the south of England heat, as comics Blank Peng, Fab Goualin, Sharifa Butterfly, Sydney May and Evaldas Karosas battle it out to book their place in this years grand final showdown. Host Sara Pascoe is joined by stand-up comics Catherine Bohart and Michael Odewale, who appear alongside Fatiha El-Ghorri on the panel of judges

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The Boiler Shop arts and performance space in Newcastle is the venue for the fourth heat, which sees comics Charlie Ashton, Murph, Zoe Cousin, Caira OConnor and Shugufta Choudhry battling it out to book their place in this years grand final in Bradford. Amy Gledhill hosts the proceedings and the judges for the night are Teesside local Phil Dunning, former winner Dan Tiernan and head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Christopher MacArthur-Boyd hosts the fifth heat at the Barrowland Ballroom in Glasgow, where five acts take to the stage in front of a packed house and judges Daniel Foxx, Susie McCabe and Fatiha El-Ghorri. Ayo Adenekan, Alan Jay, Kate Dolan, Calum Frost and Joe da Costa perform five minute sets in hopes of earning a place in the final at the Alhambra Theatre in Bradford

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Dane Buckley hosts the contest at Mandela Hall, Belfast, where five comics compete in the last of six knockout heats to bag their place in the grand final. Award-winning comedian and podcaster Alison Spittle and former NCA finalist William Thompson join head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri to assess the potential of contenders Eoghan Collins, Pravanya Pillay, Vinny Shiu, Lianna Holston and Jim Midge

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Amy Gledhill hosts the final from the Alhambra Theatre in Bradford, the 2025 City of Culture. The six heat winners take to the stage once more before head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri and her fellow panellists decide who will take this years title of Best New Comedian. Joining her is stand-up comedian Harriet Kemsley and Adjani Salmon, the writer and star of hit comedy Dreaming Whilst Black. Theres also a routine from last years champion Paul Hilleard, before he hands over the trophy to his successor

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.sub-title: Coke, Weed and Bananas: A Guide to Drugs Today
programme.desc: Joby Mageean takes a light-hearted look at the root of societys drugs problem, via Gary Barlow, disco biscuits and bananas

programme.title: Doctor Who Confidential
programme.desc: The demands of filming at Stonehenge in winter, and the origins of the Pandorica are explored by the cast

programme.title: Doctor Who Confidential
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the making of the series finale, The Big Bang. Plus, highlights of Matt Smith and Karen Gillans trip to promote the show in the USA

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Time Lord receives a warning about the opening of the Pandorica, a box that legend says is a prison for the most deadly being in the universe. As the Doctor resolves to stop the threat, he finds that the key could be a love story that survives for thousands of years. Matt Smith and Karen Gillan star, with Alex Kingston returning as River Song

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, the Wests join the Shipmans for one of Micks famous turkey dinners. Smithy can hardly wait to spend his first yuletide with baby Neil, but fails to realise Dave will be tagging along and playing happy families with Nessa. Meanwhile, Gavin and Stacey make an announcement that does not exactly fill their friends and relatives with joy, and Bryn has a heart-to-heart with Jason. Festive edition of the comedy from 2008, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Two single women living on opposite sides of the Atlantic agree to exchange houses over the Christmas holidays. In their new surroundings, both women unexpectedly encounter prospective partners, but as the house swap draws to a close, difficult decisions have to be made about their blossoming relationships. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jack Black, Jude Law and Eli Wallach

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Sitcom about a father and daughter reunited when the latter falls pregnant. Exhausted Gemma, living with her three-month-old daughter, sees her formerly estranged mother Davina move in. Instead of helping, her mum lives an irritatingly carefree life. Meanwhile, father Malcolm is living back at the bedsit, sleeping on an inflatable bed on the landing. Missing her dad and in a state of despair, Gemma conspires with Malcolm and Derek to hatch a plot to oust Davina. Starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The search for the UKs Next Drag Race Superstar is nearly over, and Mama Ru is testing the queens comedy chops with a challenge that has seen many a well-seasoned queen fall at the last hurdle, the comedy roast - and this one comes with an added new-age twist. Comedian, writer and actor Sophie Willan is on hand to help coach the queens and joins Ru, Michelle Visage, and Alan Carr on the judging panel as the contestants vie for a much coveted place in the final

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Janet struggles to accept Jonnys death, and decides she must race through the stages of grief - denial, anger, bargaining, depression and acceptance - for the sake of her son Corinthian. Louise struggles to convince her friends she is pregnant while keeping her Auntie Val in the dark. Comedy, starring Sheridan Smith

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Louise becomes desperate to move in with Janet, but is repeatedly rebuffed, and tries to persuade her by contacting the spirit of Jonny in a suspicious seance. Donna comes to the conclusion that her slightly camp boss Tim is homosexual, even though he is happily married with children, and resolves to help him come out of the closet

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Louise makes a distressing discovery about her pregnancy. Gaz trains Munch to be his best man and Janet picks an unconventional theme for Donnas wedding - Dead Jonny

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Gaz and Donnas wedding turns out to be a morbid affair, prompting the groom to draw up a list of things to do before he dies and his bride to confront her fear of death by taking a job in a charity shop. Janet sees Munch in one of Johnnys old tracksuits, and Louise makes a shocking discovery about Corinthian

programme.sub-title: Bird Call/Let It Bee/The Staff Of Wisdom/The Snake Dance
programme.desc: Chanterelle has built a whistle that can reproduce the most beautiful sound of the forest: the one of the Nightingale. / Wanting to rush off to climb Mush Mountain, Mush-Mush is in a hurry checking nectar level in flowers – a job that takes time and care. / Mush-Mush is amazed by the way Mushpot uses his staff of wisdom and how awesome it makes him look. / When Mush-Mush and Chep lose Lilit’s flying disc down a snake tunnel, he is confident he can get it back.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

Our friends, track down Starmush, hoping his powers can save it. / When Fung and Miff spoil Mush-Mush’s fun tunnel surprise he has been working on for ages, he wishes their day was ruined too.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Compost to Go/Dare for more/A day with Starmush/The Mysterious Seepod

And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie cooks Thanksgiving dinner for 10 people, while Doug takes pity on a stranger who has been left waiting for a lift - but his good intentions backfire. With Leah Remini and Kevin James

programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie is angry to learn Ray threw a party in her house 20 years previously, and responds by spurning him in favour of Robert. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Doris Roberts and Brad Garrett

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert and Ray are asked to film a video tribute to Frank, who has been named Man of the Year at his lodge, but find none of the other members can stand him

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank is injured just before going on a Caribbean cruise with Marie, so Ray takes his place, sharing a tiny cabin with his mother and being mistaken for her lover. programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Cranes set off on a road trip in a motor home, but Martin complicates matters by inadvertently driving into Canada - which means they have to try to sneak Daphne back across the border due to the terms of her American visa. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, John Mahoney and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier decide to collaborate on a self-help book about sibling relationships. After struggling to write it they lock themselves in a hotel room until it is finished, but petty jealousy reigns and the Crane brothers are soon at each others throats

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Food critic Gil takes over the radio show to cover for an ailing Frasier - who immediately fears his job is under threat and resolves to get back on air without delay. Comedy, starring Edward Hibbert and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles meets his brother at Cafe Nervosa, where Frasier reflects on his first year in Seattle - and whether he is actually happy with his life in the city. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.sub-title: If You Talk Nice to Me
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe is on a quest to buy a rare cycle car he has coveted for more than two years, but it is going to take a lot of luck and charm to seal the deal

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Channel 4s midday news summary

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: Three sets of chefs serve dinner in Birmingham, where the first venue is seafood restaurant The Oyster Club, hosted by head chef Rosie and front of house Jess

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon OBrien and Henry Cole meet Gaby, whose garden is strewn with interesting items. From a mass of tangled weeds, Henry pulls out a vintage sack barrow, while Simon finds a shepherds stove hidden in the undergrowth

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with John Thomson in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against words and numbers

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Medical couple Rooman and Richard dream of buying a holiday bolthole in the sun, for quick getaways whenever they get the chance. Spain has always been their favourite holiday destination, and theyve chosen the coastal town of Fuengirola to find their perfect place. Jean Johansson lines up five properties for their budget of £130,000, but will any be perfect enough for them to put in an offer?

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: In Normandy, Hayley and Lee deal with the fallout from some very wet and windy weather. In Italy, Francessca and Carl juggle running one village with the renovation of another, while Cesidio looks to the future of his borgo and puts plans in place for the next generation to take the reins

programme.title: Jasmine Harmans Renovation in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine and the family have been living in their Spanish villa for over a year while the builders work around them, turning it into a contemporary modern home. With a large summer party planned and guests about to arrive, can they gather momentum for the final push and complete all the work in time?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Keen foodies Jean and Michael are ready to move to Mijas Costa in southern Spain to enjoy its culture and active lifestyle. Mijas boasts gorgeous beaches and has retained its authentic traditional charm with its pretty whitewashed town full of picturesque plazas - the perfect place to enjoy the Spanish lifestyle. Leah Charles-King shows them five great options for their maximum budget of £315,000, from a turnkey treat to a place giving dome-estic bliss

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: In Tenerife, squatters are taking over homes prompting hotels and property owners to turn to hard-man evictors to get them out. The Canary Islands attract 16 million tourists a year, but a deepening housing crisis is turning the Spanish region into a battleground, as people who say they can no longer afford soaring rents are occupying other peoples properties instead. Under Spanish law, once people occupy a property for 48 hours, a court order is needed to evict them - and this can take years. Reporter Anja Popp joins a controversial new force of private eviction teams employed by property owners

programme.title: Rory Peck Awards
programme.sub-title: Ramita Navai - Gaza: Doctors Under Attack
programme.desc: Reporter Ramita Navai tells the stories of the front-line medics who stayed at their posts as their hospitals and clinics became war zones in the Gaza conflict. Ramita is a finalist for the Rory Peck Awards 2025, which celebrate the freelance film-makers who bring the worlds stories to the worlds TV screens

programme.title: Secrets of Supercheap Shopping
programme.desc: Shoplifting surges as food prices climb, prompting OneBeyond founder Chris Edwards to get on top of a problem that is costing both him and his shoppers money. Plus, the price-cutting pet food retailer who is using Goldilocking to ensure his pricing strategy is just right and a test to see whether shoppers can taste the difference between discounted products that are past their best before date and supermarket ones that are still in date

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, Squid Game: The Challenge, All Her Fault, Celebrity Race Across the World, Alan Carrs Picture Slam, Emmerdale, Knife Edge: Chasing Michelin Stars and Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly: Australia

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by guests including Harriet Kemsley for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. As usual, the hashtag #isitok paves the way for the gang to round up, examine and explain the leading and most entertaining news stories of the week

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Home Bird Live
programme.desc: Stand-up show recorded in 2014 at Newcastles Tyne Theatre and Opera House, in which the comedian shares humorous insights into her life, including the need to put down some roots now she has cats. She also offers advice on what to take away on a dirty weekend, how to teach a pensioner to swear and the correct number of meals to consume in a day

programme.title: Bad Hair
programme.desc: An ambitious young black TV presenter is told that she does not have the right look to make it in the image-obsessed world of music television. She agrees to get a weave to change her look, but finds her fashionable new hairstyle has a deadly mind of its own. Comedy horror, starring Elle Lorraine and Vanessa Williams

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in Redondo Beach, California, for the first of two visits to Zayna Flaming Grill, a Mediterranean restaurant owned and run by aunt and niece Faye and Brenda. Faye believes she has the weight of the entire restaurant on her shoulders, while Brenda feels she isnt treated as an equal in the business. With tensions rising, the food not up to scratch and everyone playing the blame game, the chef is faced with one of the trickiest situations hes ever encountered

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Shelley Guest House in Aberystwyth, where its husband-and-wife owners hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money by providing their guests with an old-school form of entertainment, some Spanish cuisine and a monumental continental breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests travel to the five-star Ixworth House in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, where hosts John and Sharyn Snell are quietly confident their establishment will impress. John reveals his hidden talents at dinner, but his performance at breakfast the next morning does not go down well with all of the fellow BandB owners

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In York, part-time panto dame Graham Smith runs the Georgian House and Mews, and takes his guests back in time with a Nordic test of strength. At supper, Hazel has romance on her mind, but the guests are left to fend for themselves at breakfast - until Graham makes a show-stopping appearance

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the George Hotel in Orton, Cumbria, for the fourth visit of the day. Owner Hazel McAleese organises a fishing trip as the afternoon activity, during which one of the guests decides to use the opportunity to give everyone a lesson in innuendo

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the contest reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the BandB owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien are in the South Wales Valleys, where sisters Carly and Holly ask them to dig out some treasure from their fathers unwanted collection of furniture

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Coach acquires an antique weighing machine that also gives out fortunes - which start coming true in eerie fashion - but Diane brushes off the predictions as coincidence, until she is forced to revise her opinion

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam lies to Diane about his plans for a weekend away, and Coach tries to break his record for fewest glasses smashed in a month, while Norm starts spending all his time with a new friend, leaving Cliff feeling neglected. American bar-room comedy, starring Ted Danson

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Coach is upset about the death of an old baseball buddy and holds a memorial to him in the bar, but then discovers the man once propositioned his wife. Nicholas Colasanto stars

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Norm is cajoled into pursuing an attractive new client who seems to be interested in him, but ends up realising how much he appreciates his wife. Comedy, starring George Wendt

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra takes Ally and the twins to her parents house, leaving Ray at home by himself - and he finds it impossible to get to sleep. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Peter Boyle

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: A desperate Ray does everything he can to get to the front of the queue to meet the New York Mets 1969 team at the National Baseball Hall of Fame. Comedy, starring Ray Romano

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Seattle shrink reads a steamy novel written by an old acquaintance from Boston - and discovers his teenage affair with a piano teacher has found its way into the plot. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Eddie impregnates a neighbours dog, so Frasier decides to have him neutered. However, the elusive mutt has no intention of accepting his fate and flees into the city. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart feels neglected when Homer and Lisa bond over To Kill a Mockingbird and start spending quality time together, so Marge tries to help her husband divide his attentions equally

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart tries to impress his tough new friends by decapitating a statue of the towns founder Jebediah Springfield, but his act of vandalism only succeeds in turning everybody against him

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.sub-title: 2025 Las Vegas Grand Prix Qualifying Highlights
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the battle for grid positions in the 22nd round of the season at Las Vegas Strip Circuit. With analysis from David Coulthard

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: The owners of three restaurants in Oxfordshire battle it out, where a lack of rice, no choice of how meat is cooked and a showstopping souffle are on the menu

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Loretta and Carl from Leicester hope to find the perfect holiday home in the seaside resort of Mojácar in south-east Spain. With busy and stressful jobs, they want a bolthole in the sun where they can relax and unwind whenever they like. Laura Hamilton shows them five options within their £100,000. Will Loretta and Carl love any of them enough to put in an offer?

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a couple who are converting a rusty ships wheelhouse into head-turning accommodation for their Welsh glampsite. In Scotland, George revisits a designer who he met on the first series to see a pair of his gorgeous new eco-builds. He ends his Denmark trip at a modernist home and finally gets to reveal his own amazing space - a cabin in the sky, built on an old scissor lift

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Karen and Richard have a large budget but no luck when it comes to making a deal, so they enlist the help of Kirstie Allsopp in their search for a family home in the West Midlands. Having already sold up in London, the pair are desperate to settle down with their three children but Kirstie thinks it might be their very specific wish list that is the problem. Camilla and Liam are struggling to keep up with the fast-moving market and can rarely book viewings before properties are sold so they ask Phil Spencer to help them in their search for a property to start a family in. With Nurse Camilla often working nightshifts, the pair are struggling to fit in some house hunting, after some time with Phil there are two contenders but some quick decisions must be made to avoid losing out yet again

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the garden city of Milton Keynes to bring harmony to a couple who are worlds apart - both physically and emotionally. Anne-Marie and Paul bought their charming-but-challenging 1920s three-bedroom home six years ago, right before the arrival of their first child. The property was a doer-upper but hasnt been done up yet! Paul wants to list it. Between his twice-a-week 160-mile commute to Manchester, the boxed-in kitchen, and the unforgivable absence of a bathtub in their only bathroom, hes ready to cut his losses and move on. Anne-Marie, on the other hand, refuses to throw in the towel. With family close by and a belief in the houses untapped potential, shes clinging to her dream and counting on Kirstie to work her magic and convince Paul to fall in love with their home again. With a £50,000 Love It budget and an ambitious to-do list, Kirstie gets straight to work, crafting a master plan to unlock every ounce of the houses potential. But just as things get rolling, disaster strikes - a surprise roof repair gobbles up a significant chunk of the budget, leaving Team Love It to rethink their strategy. Meanwhile, Phil takes Anne-Marie and Paul to Rugby, hoping to split the commute burden, and finds jaw-dropping properties with his £500,000 List It budget that leave Anne-Marie questioning her allegiances and Paul well and truly sold

programme.title: New Zealands Best Homes with Phil Spencer
programme.desc: In Auckland suburb Parnell, Phil visits a city home for a busy family, surrounded by gardens. Out in the countryside, Phil meets architect Jo Craddock at her split-level home, which is made out of cedar and concrete with bespoke timber joinery, five bedrooms, two large living areas, a 25-metre lap pool, a 50-metre hallway and its own jetty. In Queenstown, Phil visits The Lake House, an extensive renovation on the banks of Lake Hayes, which contains a number of hidden doors and secret rooms

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Bettany Hughes Treasures of the World
programme.sub-title: Hidden Estonia: Land of Fire and Ice
programme.desc: Bettanys journey into Estonias rich history begins in a lab where archaeology and genetics intersect to reveal a portrait of a prehistoric teen derived from a 10,000-year-old piece of chewed tar. Bettany immerses herself in the traditions of an Orthodox community that maintains ancient pre-Christian beliefs, explores Estonias underwater heritage, and wraps up the trip with a mystical smoke sauna and a taste of a viper-infused spirit

programme.title: New Zealand by Train
programme.desc: New Zealand is home to some of the worlds most spectacular landscapes, and this two-part series explores three of the countrys major scenic rail journeys. The first episode follows two rail routes on South Island, the spectacular Coastal Pacific running through the hills and vineyards of Marlborough to the small coastal town Kaikoura, and the TranzAlpine, crossing the Canterbury Plains towards the Southern Alps and Arthurs Pass National Park. Narrated by Julie Walters

programme.title: Hitlers DNA: Blueprint of a Dictator
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team discover that Hitler may have had a genetic mutation that causes a medical condition called Kallmann Syndrome, which disrupts the development of sex organs. Turi King and the team make several extraordinary genetic discoveries concerning Hitlers high likelihood of suffering from schizophrenia and bipolar disorder

programme.title: The Serpent Queen
programme.desc: Historical drama, starring Samantha Morton. At the tender age of 14, orphan Catherine de Medici is forced into a political marriage orchestrated by the pope. Thrust into a world of shifting fortunes, she adapts quickly to secure her place as one of the most powerful and longest-serving rulers in French history

programme.title: Bad Boys for Life
programme.desc: The widow of a crime lord escapes from a Mexican prison with the help of her son. She sends him to recover the stash of money his father had hidden, as well as assassinating those responsible for his dads arrest - with Miami detective Mike Lowrey laston the hit list. Action sequel, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Paola Nunez and Vanessa Hudgens

programme.title: Vengeance
programme.desc: A writer from New York City attempts to solve the murder of a young woman he hooked up with, and sets out to investigate the circumstances of her death. Mystery drama, written, directed by and starring BJ Novak, with Boyd Holbrook and Lio Tipton

programme.title: Double the Money
programme.desc: Round 3 sees the remaining teams afforded one week to double £1,000. The twins host an event for local ladies in Leeds, while married couple Nissy and Ben offer a webinar on how to have a happy marriage. On Bournemouth beach, a father and son decide to run a hook-a-duck game, but at £5 a go theyll need a lot of customers to reach the £2,000 target. Best friends Radhika and Seema host an erotic art workshop on an industrial estate in north-west London for £75 per person, while in Telford, Dale and Harvey attempt to stage a talent show contest. Hosted by Sue Perkins

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zekes, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Mike makes fun of Duck when his whistle creates funny noises, but when he does his own whistle a mischief, he cannot take being teased himself

programme.desc: Raj lusts after a girl he and Sheldon meet at a university party, and Leonard comes to regret airing his disapproval of Pennys belief in psychics. Comedy, starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Psychotic Sideshow Bob is released from Springfield Penitentiary thirsting for revenge - prompting Bart and the rest of the family to join the witness protection programme. Featuring the guest voice of Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A routine check reveals Homer is not qualified to work as a safety inspector at the power plant, so he goes back to college to study for a degree - but spends all his time playing pranks and ends up failing his exams

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A trip down memory lane is on the cards when Homer finds an old film strip, leading to family flashbacks telling the story of Bart and Lisas troublesome toddler years - and how they got into their first fight

programme.title: Animal Control
programme.desc: Emily hires an expert canine trainer to help with the kennel dogs

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: The hopefuls receive a makeover before taking part in an Alice in Wonderland-themed photoshoot, but Alexandrias diva-like behaviour causes friction

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt and his team are implicated in a bombing at the Kremlin, forcing the American president to declare them fugitives. The spies plan to clear their name by abducting the real terrorist, which leads them into a pursuit around the globe. However, Hunt cannot be sure his colleagues are trustworthy. Action adventure sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg and Paula Patton

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels undermined when his parking space at the university is allocated to Howard instead, and his determination to cling on to the spot causes a rift in the pairs friendship. However, the battle between the boys pales in comparison to that waged by Amy and Bernadette, whose disagreement on behalf of their significant others becomes increasingly personal. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As part of the relationship agreement, Sheldon reluctantly has to take care of Amy when she gets sick, but she loves the extra attention so much she pretends to remain in poor health. Elsewhere, Howard tries to get some tips on manliness from Penny when he and Bernadette go to visit her father

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. Single mum Tracy from Bedfordshire has been out of the dating game since she split with her fiancee three years ago and hopes to find a man who matches her adventurous side, while London sales adviser Matthew, 24, is tired of dating apps and thinks online profiles mean girls never actually see the real him. Anna Richardson hosts

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A particularly bad episode of Itchy and Scratchy prompts Bart and Lisa to write their own script and send it to the shows producer under Grampas name. With the voice of Brooke Shields

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The young genius is forced to help Georgie revise for a maths test when poor grades threaten his brothers future on the football team. In doing so, he manages to pick up a few skills himself. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Montana Jordan

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: An Eagle Feather, a String Bean and an Eskimo
programme.desc: The young genius moves to Dallas to attend a school for gifted children, the family struggles to cope without him around any more. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Dave and Gemma face a devastating loss, Calvin and Tina offer emotional support and reflect on a period that tested their own family

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin and Tina enlist the services of a professional matchmaker for Marty, but get too caught up in the process. Dave and Gemma adopt new roles during an unexpected date night

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: As Halloween draws near, Calvin tries to discover what is behind the strange occurrences in his home. Gemma and Tina question if their days of sexy costumes should be behind them

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin is thrilled when he unexpectedly crosses paths with NFL legend Jerome The Bus Bettis, until he discovers the Hall of Fame football player shares a history with Tina

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Nashville, Tennessee, the spiritual home of country music, but his visit begins on a sour note at Chappys Cajun restaurant. Chef John Chapmans careless methods have damaged his reputation, but he blames the local clientele rather than his less-than-appetising food and disturbing kitchen practices. Can Gordon get through to this stubborn owner and save the eatery from disaster?

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Amusing internet videos, featuring a variety of boats, animals surfing, and a dating agency for sea captains, while there is dancing from across the world

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: After a mould issue at home forces Erica and Geoff to stay at the Goldbergs, Beverly senses tensions in their marriage and seizes the opportunity to impart a little marital advice

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly is not coping well with the idea of an empty nest as Adams graduation day approaches, while Erica decides to try out as a back-up singer

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: In the wake of Murrays passing, Adam, Barry and Erica are all back at home to be closer to their mother, and the house is full of Goldberg chaos, which is driving pregnant Erica bonkers. She enlists Beverlys help to clear things out for the baby, while Adam and Barry have to share a bedroom to make room for the baby nursery

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam is worried about how Beverly will handle him going off to college, so he tries to get a dream job right in their hometown

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Some unlikely friends take Adam out for a night in Jenkintown. Joanne quickly realises her new job at the law firm is not what she expected

programme.title: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: The feud between Zeyno and Jazz is further enflamed when Zeyno calls out Jazz for enjoying shady comments about Livvy. Jules devotion to her best friend is tested when Jazz accuses her of disloyalty. Sam Prince has decided that Livvy is a kindred spirit - and that Chuggs is a terrible match for her. As Chuggs admits that hes ready to forgive Livvy, he finds out that Sam Prince has been badmouthing him to her behind his back

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he meets husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who reveal a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faces the biggest challenge of the series to save Amys Baking Company, but can he get through to this defiant pair?

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: A look at what happened after Gordon Ramsay headed to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he met husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who revealed a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faced the biggest challenge of the series to save Amys Baking Company - and a media furore unfolded after the episode was broadcast

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Denver, Colorado, where he meets the stubborn owner of Italian restaurant Pantaleones, who appears to be firmly stuck in the past. Pete maintains he makes the best pizza in town - based on a review from the 1980s - but the fiery chefs own taste test proves the opposite. With Petes wife Paulette and son Josh threatening to leave, can Gordon get through to him and save the business?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy about scientists and their friendship with a down-to-earth neighbour. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon helps Leonard drop off a parcel for Penny, but when he sees how messy her flat is, he tries to do a good deed - which is not well received. Johnny Gale, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is upset to learn Penny is dating someone, so his friends encourage him to seek a new romance by asking another woman out. Sara Gilbert appears alongside her Rosen co-star Johnny Gale

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is fired for being disrespectful to his boss, and explores new activities in a bid to find a purpose in life other than physics, but Leonard takes drastic action to restore him to his old self. Laurie Metcalf guest stars as Sheldons mother

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard fears he is wasting his time with Penny and ends up spending the night with fellow scientist Leslie. However, he is disappointed when she later tells him she was only interested in a one-night stand. Meanwhile, Sheldon frets over a change to his hamburger routine. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is shocked at a revelation from Sheldon after she buys him a new laptop, while Raj sells out Leonard and Howard after they lie to their wives in order to attend an early screening of a movie. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: On a weekend cabin trip with Penny and Amy, Sheldon spills one of Leonards secrets, while Howard and Bernadette must draw a line when Raj goes overboard with pregnancy gifts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon disagree over whether to continue holding their regular Roommate Agreement meetings, with Leonard suggesting they are no longer required, while Sheldon believes they are still essential. As the pairs squabble quickly escalates into a full-blown argument, the rest of their friends turn up for a planned Game of Thrones viewing party, and end up taking sides in the dispute - resulting in two warring factions taking up residence in 4A and 4B. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of Charlestown in Cornwall, revealing how the villagess namesake Charles Rashleigh transformed the local trade and commerce from fishing and distribution of pilchards, to minerals exported by a hand-built port with pioneering technology. Ben looks at how Charles commissioned renowned engineer John Smeaton to create man-made lakes and hand-dug ponds, and explores their impact on the villages prosperity

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson pays a visit to the beautifully preserved village of Arnside, sitting just outside the Lake District on the banks of the River Kent. Once serving the port of Milnthorpe, the village expanded with the arrival of ship carpenter John Crossfield, leading to its expansion in the early 1800s as part of the boat-building industry. Ben talks to Victorian industry expert Dr Stephen Caunce and meets a descendant of the Crossfields family, talking about the villages tourist success and architectural history

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits a small village in Northumberland to find out how the family and village who both share the name Craster have had their lives and fortunes intertwined for over 800 years

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The strategies adopted by plants that enable them to grow in every possible environment, even where there is no sunlight, water or nutrients. Featuring the dragons blood tree, which survives in the desert by converting moisture found in the mist and shading its own roots, the carnivorous Venus flytrap that has evolved into an extraordinary predator able to digest insects, and the cats claw creeper, which uses other plants as a ladder to reach sunlight. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The focus turns to apes and monkeys, revealing their similarities to humans. Large armies of hamadryas baboons battle on the plains of Ethiopia to steal females and settle old scores, while Japanese macaques beat the cold by lounging in thermal springs. An orang-utan baby fails in its struggle to make an umbrella out of leaves, and capuchins try to smash nuts with a large rock. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earths natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberias Lake Baikal, home to the worlds only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earths tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton
programme.desc: Lord Loam is proud of his tendency to treat his staff as equals - to a point - while his manservant Crichton believes people should know their place. However, when the entire household is shipwrecked on a desert island, it is the resourceful butler who rises to the top of the pecking order - to the horror of his supposedly liberal master. Comedy based on JM Barries play, starring Kenneth More, Cecil Parker, Diane Cilento and Peter Graves

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: Biopic of Winston Churchill, following the future prime ministers formative years. While working as a journalist, he travels to Africa to report on the Boer Wars, an assignment that leads to his incarceration in a prison camp. He escapes from captivity and returns to England to begin a political career. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft and Robert Shaw

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: A headstrong New England mayor launches one final re-election campaign. However, he finds the nature of politics is changing and he has a powerful enemy in a wealthy and influential local banker. John Fords drama, starring Spencer Tracy, Basil Rathbone, Jeffrey Hunter and Pat OBrien

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: A fleet of huge flying saucers launches a devastating and unprovoked attack on Earth. As survivors try to flee the seemingly unstoppable alien invaders, the courageous US president, an ace pilot and a computer genius come up with a plan to take the fight to the enemy and save the human race. Roland Emmerichs sci-fi adventure, starring Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell, Randy Quaid, Robert Loggia and Harry Connick Jr

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: A computer programmer working for the worlds biggest search engine is given the opportunity to spend a week at the remote home of his boss, a hi-tech genius. The break turns out to be an elaborate experiment, in which he must test the worlds first truly artificial intelligence, which is housed in the body of a beautiful robot girl. Sci-fi drama, starring Domhnall Gleeson, Alicia Vikander and Oscar Isaac

programme.title: Men
programme.desc: When her ex-husband dies, a woman decides to take a solo vacation to the countryside but suspects she is being stalked during her stay. Writer/director Alex Garlands horror, starring Jessie Buckley, Rory Kinnear, Paapa Essiedu and Gayle Rankin

programme.title: Let Him Go
programme.desc: Retired sheriff George Blackledge and his horse trainer wife Margaret live on a ranch in 1960s Montana, with their son James, his wife Lorna and their son Jimmy. A freak riding accident takes James life, and the Blackledges watch helplessly as Lorna eventually marries Donnie, who communicates with his fists. Crime drama, starring Diane Lane, Kevin Costner and Kayli Carter

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water
programme.desc: The cheery sea creature tries to prevent a precious secret formula from falling into the wrong hands - but when it goes missing, the end of the world approaches. SpongeBob and his friends embark on a quest to get it back, which leads to them developing superpowers and venturing onto dry land. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny and Antonio Banderas

programme.title: Think Like a Dog
programme.desc: A 12-year-old tech prodigys science experiment goes awry and he forges a telepathic connection with his dog. The duo join forces and use their unique perspectives on life to overcome complications of family and school. Family comedy drama, starring Josh Duhamel, Megan Fox and Gabriel Bateman

programme.title: Mysterious Island
programme.desc: Soldiers escaping the American Civil War take flight in a giant observation balloon and land far away on a strange uncharted island, where they encounter giant creatures, cut-throat pirates, two shipwrecked Englishwomen - and the mysterious Captain Nemo. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Vernes novel, starring Michael Craig, Herbert Lom, Joan Greenwood and Michael Callan, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Enemy Mine
programme.desc: In the midst of a war between humans and aliens, two space pilots from opposite sides are marooned together on an inhospitable planet and are forced to set aside their mutual animosity to survive. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dennis Quaid, Louis Gossett Jr and Brion James

programme.title: Men in Black: International
programme.desc: The intergalactic law enforcers have always protected the Earth from the scum of the universe. This time they tackle their biggest threat - a mole in the Men in Black organisation. Director F Gary Grays fantasy sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Rebecca Ferguson

programme.title: Nobody
programme.desc: A quiet and unassuming family man slowly reveals his true character after his house is burgled by two petty thieves. The aftermath of the incident ignites his long-simmering rage, triggering dormant instincts and propelling him on a brutal path that brings to the surface dark secrets and lethal skills. Crime drama, starring Bob Odenkirk, Connie Nielsen and Aleksey Serebryakov

programme.title: Monster Hunter
programme.desc: When Cpt Artemis and her loyal soldiers are transported to a new world, they engage in a desperate battle for survival against enormous enemies with incredible powers. Fantasy adventure based on the video game, starring Milla Jovovich, Tony Jaa and Ron Perlman

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections

programme.title: Anaconda
programme.desc: Film-makers venture deep into the Amazon jungle to document the lives of a remote tribe. However, the expedition is hijacked by a crazed hunter who plans to use them as bait to catch a gigantic killer snake. Adventure, starring Jennifer Lopez, Jon Voight, Ice Cube, Eric Stoltz and Jonathan Hyde

programme.desc: A scout hired to steer a wagon train through Sioux territory hopes to maintain good relations with local tribespeople. However, the actions of a few foolhardy hotheads in the convoy endanger the fragile peace, and a planned robbery threatens to spark an all-out war. Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Walter Matthau, Elsa Martinelli and Lon Chaney Jr

programme.title: Pony Express
programme.desc: Buffalo Bill Cody and Wild Bill Hickok work on establishing an east-west route for the pioneering mail service that will allow messages to be sent from Missouri to California in 10 days. However, they have to contend with saboteurs planning to prevent California becoming part of the Union. Western, starring Charlton Heston, Forrest Tucker, Rhonda Fleming and Jan Sterling

programme.title: Will Penny
programme.desc: An ageing cowboy takes a job on a ranch, driving off trespassers from the owners land. However, when he finds a woman and his son hiding out in a cabin, he takes pity on them and allows them to stay. But as an attraction develops between them, a bandit the cowboy had crossed in the past comes looking for him. Western, starring Charlton Heston, Joan Hackett and Donald Pleasence

In other first-round matches, Luke Littler was the only player to win 6-0, impressing against Luke Cross, and Thibault Tricole caused an upset when he prevailed 6-4 against Gerwyn Price. Jacqui Oatley and Ned Boulting present, with analysis from Chris Mason, Alan Warriner-Little and Mark Webster, and commentary by Stuart Pyke and John Rawling

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Would-be clairvoyant Janet hosts the second of a week of dinner parties in Leeds and hopes her ghoul-themed dinner party will help her win the cash prize. With more surprises in store, will the fright-night theme be enough to ghost Janet into the lead?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
